TopicTitle: [1.2.2] Stock Part Revamp, Update 1.9.6. Released Source Files!

Articles.Content:
SRB on left looks like AJ-60A.

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/98/Atlas_V_SRB_without_Nose_cone.jpg

Lovely little booster that 4 nozzle one is. Very unique.

Thanks for that info. They just looked a bit weird so I wanted to confirm.

The Pruners need to be in a folder in the same directory as the KSP application.

Mine are and some of them work, but not all. I can't check right now which ones in particular, but yeah, some don't work.

Really Awesome mod, but on major flaw I saw:

If you reload a save that previously didn't have this, unmanned (apparently not manned) spacecraft can't function and glitch out . Hopefully you can fix this at some point

I'm having an issue where on re-entry, the MK1 command pod dives downward instead of the heat shield directly underneath it. This happened in stock 1.0 but was fixed in a hotfix but after installing your mod it came back.

I'm having an issue where on re-entry, the MK1 command pod dives downward instead of the heat shield directly underneath it. This happened in stock 1.0 but was fixed in a hotfix but after installing your mod it came back.

weird.. mine worked fine
so i've noticed the auto-tankbutts are activating on tanks where they shouldn't. is there a fix for this? can i just turn off auto-tankbutts?
Use the engines other attachment node. There's two on top - one includes the tankbutt, one does't. They're pretty close together on some engines, so just keep trying.
They're kinda annoyingly close, you have to fiddle with the position a lot because the engine seems to refuse attaching to the lower node.

ok i'll try that tonight. and i'm sure this was answered somewhere in this 179 pg thread, but what's the deal with solar panels? even for new craft, i cannot retract any panels that have been toggled open. the solarpanelsretractfix.cfg doesn't appear to fix it either.

ok i'll try that tonight. and i'm sure this was answered somewhere in this 179 pg thread, but what's the deal with solar panels? even for new craft, i cannot retract any panels that have been toggled open. the solarpanelsretractfix.cfg doesn't appear to fix it either.

That's an intentional change in stock. The OX-4W and OX-4L can't be retracted by design.

Is the revamped "Poodle" engine taller than the stock version? I feel like I had a harder time putting landing struts on the revamped version than I remember having with stock, but I'm also wrong occasionally.

I'd recommend the ALCOR mod for a more "Apollo style" lander pod.

I don't like the ALCOR. It's not stockalike at all, from the IVA to the exterior.

Is the revamped "Poodle" engine taller than the stock version?

No, exactly the same height, it just looks bigger.

EDIT: Also, with HotRockets, the Mainsail effects clip into the nozzle.

Edited May 27, 2015 by ObsessedWithKSP

I don't like the ALCOR. It's not stockalike at all, from the IVA to the exterior.

Maybe not, but it's the only lander pod that allows you a full IVA flight experience in an elegant way. She's my go to without a question.

On another note: coming in HOT!
It would be absolutely terrific if the windows in this looked like in the WindowShine mod.

It would be absolutely terrific if the windows in this looked like in the WindowShine mod.

They already do, Ven added texturereplacer support long ago.

I love everything in this pack however I am not really find of the heat shield textures. Someone posted a way to get rid of the textures but for the life of me i can't find it on this thread. If someone could post it again I would really appreciate it. No offense to Ven but the stock heat shields are one of the the few things I actually prefer over Vens.

I love everything in this pack however I am not really find of the heat shield textures. Someone posted a way to get rid of the textures but for the life of me i can't find it on this thread. If someone could post it again I would really appreciate it. No offense to Ven but the stock heat shields are one of the the few things I actually prefer over Vens.

If you look in vans folder you will see Structural.cfg in it you will find 

@MODEL,* {
		@model ^= :^Squad/Parts/Aero/HeatShield/HeatShield1:VenStockRevamp/Squad/Parts/Heatshields/HeatShieldS1:
	}
	@MODEL,* {
		@model ^= :^Squad/Parts/Aero/HeatShield/HeatShield2:VenStockRevamp/Squad/Parts/Heatshields/HeatShieldS2:
	}
	@MODEL,* {
		@model ^= :^Squad/Parts/Aero/HeatShield/HeatShield3:VenStockRevamp/Squad/Parts/Heatshields/HeatShieldS3:
	}

And you will see a folder Heatshields best guess delete them lines and folder.
H ven will you expand the mk2 and mk3 fuselages? They realy nead some of your GodTouch...

WARNING! If you've installed VSR 1.8.0 or earler, close all of your solar panels before installing 1.8.1+.

I've fixed the solar panels orientation, so they won't cause problems during a stock > VSR or VSR > stock conversion.

Drag and drop the SolarPanelRetractFix.txt, into your game data folder before the rest of the mod, and convert it to .cfg. Then load up KSP and close all of your solar panels (the extra solar panels are an exception). Close KSP and delete the entire Stock revamp folder, and then install the mod normally.

This wasn't very clear to me - I misunderstood that if I was installing VSR for the first time ever, I didn't have to retract panels first. I installed with CKAN, loaded up, and my panels 1x6 were twisted sideways, and I could no longer retract the panels.

I tried renaming the fix to cfg but that didn't work to let me retract them either, so I moved the cfg to the GameData (out of VSR dir), still didn't work. Removed VSR, tried again.. not only doesn't work, my craft are all messed up with weird spacing between parts. Solar panels are oriented right though, but I still can't open/close them.

Is there something I could regex replace in the persistent.sfs to fix this? I don't really want to have to close all my RT satellite network panels and re-open them manually, anyways...

However, If you wish to save RAM, run the provided pruner files (.bat for windows, .sh for OS X and Linux) inside your KSP folder. If you choose to do this the stock parts won't be loaded into the game and in total, around 5-6 MB of RAM can be saved, but mods like SXT will more or less cease to function.

Is this a typo or not?

5-6 MB of RAM doesn't sound a great deal. I had assumed taking out the original textures would save much more.

What are people's experiences of running the bat file?

They already do, Ven added texturereplacer support long ago.

Unfortunately, it's untrue. The window reflections stop working with WindowShine installed; video example: http://a.pomf.se/bspfai.mp4

The Mk1 pod's window actually turns black after installing WindowShine. This is in a fresh install of KSP with no other mods and with Ven's, TextureReplacer and Module Manager installed from CKAN and then WindowShine installed on top.

Additionally, the cupola and Mk2 lander can reflections aren't working even without WindowShine; video example: http://a.pomf.se/gtccmr.mp4

I've made an issue about the cupola and Mk2 lander on GitHub.

Edited May 29, 2015 by slikts

The Cupola isn't shiny

This is in the log when I attach it:

"[Log]: [TR.TRReflection] Failed to replace any shader on "cupola" with its reflective counterpart"

With this in the TR config:

@PART[cupola]:NEEDS[TextureReplacer] { 
	%MODULE[TRReflection]
      {
        colour = 0.3 0.3 0.3
		interval = 2
		meshes = Shine
      }

Everything else shiny works fine though.

- - - Updated - - -

Unfortunately, it's untrue. The window reflections stop working with WindowShine installed; video example: http://a.pomf.se/bspfai.mp4

Why would you expect them to work? They can and probably do point to different reflective meshes, hence the conflict. As to without WindowShine, I've only noticed the cupola not reflect. The Mk2 lander can is not configured to.

Why would you expect them to work?

I wouldn't expect WindowShine to affect the custom parts because it's supposed to modify the stock parts.

Unfortunately, it's untrue. The window reflections stop working with WindowShine installed; video example: http://a.pomf.se/bspfai.mp4

The Mk1 pod's window actually turns black after installing WindowShine. This is in a fresh install of KSP with no other mods and with Ven's, TextureReplacer and Module Manager installed from CKAN and then WindowShine installed on top.

Additionally, the cupola and Mk2 lander can reflections aren't working even without WindowShine; video example: http://a.pomf.se/gtccmr.mp4

I've made an issue about the cupola and Mk2 lander on GitHub.

Why would you install windowshine and VSR at the same time? Windowshine is for the stock models, shiny windows will automatically come to you if you have VSR and texturereplacer installed.
